sec.title: Alena Bartosova
sec.p: is a Senior Researcher in hydro-biogeochemistry and an expert in water quality and watershed modelling. She has over 20 years of experience in research in surface water quality, simulation models, watershed assessments, and evaluation of pollution sources and management practices.

sec.title: René Capell
sec.p: is a researcher in hydrology at the Swedish Meteorological and Hydrological Institute (SMHI). His research interests include rainfall-runoff processes, hydrological modelling from catchment to continental scale, and environmental change impact analyses in hydrology.

sec.title: Jørgen E. Olesen
sec.p: is a Professor and head of Section of Climate and Water at Aarhus University. His research activities focus on climate change effects on crops and soils, and effects of agricultural management on carbon and nitrogen cycling.

sec.title: Mohamed Jabloun
sec.p: is a Young Researcher with PhD in Agroecology. His primary research is within the nexus of agriculture and climate change involving the development and use of process-based crop models.

sec.title: Jens Christian Refsgaard
sec.p: is a Professor at the Hydrological Department of the Geological Survey of Denmark and Greenland (GEUS). His research interests include assessments of water and nitrate fluxes at field and catchment scales.

sec.title: Chantal Donnelly
sec.p: was a Project Manager and a scientific leader in hydrology and climate change water impact assessments at the Swedish Meteorological and Hydrological Institute.

sec.title: Kari Hyytiäinen
sec.p: is a Professor in the Department of Economics and Management and Helsinki Institute of Sustainability Science (HELSUS), at University of Helsinki.

sec.title: Sampo Pihlainen
sec.p: is a Postdoctoral Researcher in the Department of Economics and Management in the University of Helsinki. His research interests focus on the economics of marine protection, natural resources, and agriculture.

sec.title: Marianne Zandersen
sec.p: is a Senior Researcher in environmental economics at the Social Science Unit, Department of Environmental Sciences at Aarhus University and co-coordinator of iClimate—Aarhus University Interdisciplinary Centre for Climate Change. Her research interests focus on the management of ecosystem services and economic aspects of climate change.

sec.title: Berit Arheimer
sec.p: is a Head of the Hydrological Research unit at SMHI and an Associate Professor in Water and Environmental Studies in Linköping University. She is a scientific leader in issues of hydrological forecasting, integrated catchment modelling world-wide, comparative hydrology, water quality management, and climate change impact on water resources.
